Definition: describes a direction that is toward the back (posterior) and towards the middle (medial) of the body or a body part
refers to the front and side of something, indicates a position or movement that is both anterior (towards the front) and lateral (towards the side).
dark and somber in color, a cool-gray
situated away from the center of the body OR from the point of attachment
the tip of a rounded or pyramid-shaped structure
lacking pores or impressed punctate markings
studded with or denoting dots or tiny holes, having the appearance of pores
reticular: characterized by a fine network or netlike structure, transverse: extended across something
having many fine filaments or branches which give a feathery appearance
the texture has granulation; not smoothed; used to describe the skin of sharks, think shark skin ;)
